1) I notice there is a large jump in the gap of how likely you are to be admitted to a college based on your income rank. If you are in the top .1%, you are 7x as likely to be admitted. 
2) I wonder if more recognition of this problem will now create change? How can this issue be solved? Will it ever truly be solved? 
3) As a junior in high school, I am starting to look at colleges and apply and this gives more information about the admission process. This information also affects how I perceive different colleges and might affect my decision-making when applying. 
4) Rigged or Real? The Truth About College Admissions:
